entry.title: Image of Asia: Celebrating While Planting Paddy in Nepal
Image of Asia: Celebrating while planting paddy in Nepal
entry.summary: In this photo by Niranjan Shrestha, farmers play with sludge as they plant paddy saplings in a field outside Kathmandu, Nepal, on Asar Pandhra day.

entry.title: Quake-hit Nepal reopens damaged heritage sites for tourists
entry.summary:
The April 25 and May 12 quakes killed more than 8,700 people and damaged hundreds of thousands of buildings in Nepal, including old temples, palaces and other historical structures that are popular with tourists.

"We are urging people to come to Nepal for holiday to help Nepal rebuild," Sherpa said in Bhaktapur, a city filled with ancient temples that is among the reopened heritage sites.

Bhesh Narayan Dahal, chief of Nepal's Department of Archaeology, said that measures have been taken to ensure that tourists are safe, and that there are plans to provide safety helmets for visitors in some places.

entry.title: Damaged heritage sites reopened in Nepal
entry.summary: Tourists fled Nepal after the first quake, but it also is currently rainy season, a time when relatively few foreign visitors are usually around.

entry.title: Quake-hit Nepal reopens damaged heritage sites for tourists
entry.summary:
Nepal has reopened most of the heritage sites that were damaged in a pair of strong earthquakes that devastated parts of the country recently, hoping to bring back foreign tourists.

About 800,000 foreign tourists visit Nepal every year and the government is worried that the fear of earthquakes will stop many from visiting the Himalayan country.

entry.title: Nepal landslides triggered by heavy rain bury at least 21 people
entry.summary: Tens of thousands of foreigners come to Nepal every year to trek on the foothills of the Himalayan peaks.

entry.title: 21 dead, dozens missing as landslide buries Nepal villages
21 dead, dozens missing as landslide buries Nepal villages
entry.summary: Also, the trails around the Langtang valley in northern Nepal were completely damaged and an entire village buried by a landslide and avalanche set off by the earthquake.

entry.title: Landslide hits 6 villages in Nepal; 15 feared dead
entry.summary: Meanwhile, the government announced Thursday it would hire international experts to study trekking routes in the mountains of Nepal to see if they are safe for hikers to return.

entry.title: Landslides kill at least 15 in Nepal
entry.summary: Scores of people die every year from flooding and landslides during the monsoon season in Nepal.

entry.title: Landslide hits 6 villages in Nepal; 15 feared dead
entry.summary: KATHMANDU, Nepal (AP) " A landslide triggered by heavy rainfall has buried six villages in Nepal's mountainous northeast and at least 15 people are believed to have been killed.

entry.title: Landslide hits 6 villages in Nepal; 15 feared dead
entry.summary: Landslides are common in mountainous Nepal during the rainy monsoon season, which began in June and ends in September.

entry.title: Political agreement paves the way for new Nepal constitution
entry.summary: The latest agreement was signed by United Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist), the main opposition party.

entry.title: Nepal's main political parties reach agreement, paving the way for a new constitution
entry.summary: The agreement says Nepal would have eight federal states.

entry.title: Political agreement paves the way for new Nepal constitution
entry.summary: KATHMANDU, Nepal (AP) " Nepal's main political parties have reached agreements on several disputed issues that could lead to the drafting of a much-delayed constitution in the Himalayan nation.

entry.title: Nepal parties resolve disputes over constitution after quake
entry.summary: Some analysts say the earthquake and its aftermath have led politicians, seen as selfish and out of touch with the plight of Nepal's poor, to show a greater sense of common purpose.

entry.title: Nepal Families of US Copter Crash Victims Seek Compensation
entry.summary:
Authorities initially said six U.S. Marines and two Nepalese soldiers were on the UH-1 "Huey" chopper that crashed May 12 in Nepal's northeastern mountains.

The remains of the villagers were flown back to Nepal on Sunday and were being stored at Tribhuwan University Teaching Hospital in Kathmandu, where relatives of the civilian victims gathered Monday.

entry.title: Nepal Families of US Copter Crash Victims Seek Compensation
